messages.subject: Re: Sandra's Book
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/13/2002 6:47:51 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Sandra, what if you compiled the essays, etc. into a good book form, and had it published
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/13/2002 6:47:51 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I already have that. <g>
>
> I have essays (most of them are hooked to a website, so maybe that was a
> bad
> idea <g>) and there were subject chats on AOL that I could review to steal
> my best ideas (back from me).
>
> I'd hate to charge people for what I'm already doing free. Books are
> different because there's a physical thing to keep, that you can read in
> the
> bed, or in the bathroom, or at a park or in the car waiting for someone.
>
>

Sandra, what if you compiled the essays, etc. into a good book form, and had
it published through iuniverse? I bet you'd sell a bunch of copies (You
could call it an Unbook, since they publish on demand), but it might be a
way of getting in print without having to market to a publisher, etc. My
best friend just did a book with them and was quite happy with it.

I'd certainly buy a copy.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
